intro: Hymenolobium mesoamericanum, commonly known as the Mesoamerican acacia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Its seeds are encased in a pod and are adapted for dispersal by animals. Hymenolobium mesoamericanum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
